BiblioData.Title: CLEAVED FACET (GA,AL,IN)N EDGE- EMITTING LASER DIODES GROWN ON SEMIPOLAR {11- 2N} BULK GALLIUM NITRIDE SUBSTRATES

Applicant.Name: UNIV CALIFORNIA [US]
THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA

BiblioData.Abstract: A III-nitride edge-emitting laser diode is formed on a surface of a III-nitride substrate having a semipolar orientation, wherein the III-nitride substrate is cleaved by creating a cleavage line along a direction substantially perpendicular to a nonpolar orientation of the III-nitride substrate, and then applying force along the cleavage line to create one or more cleaved facets of the III-nitride substrate, wherein the cleaved facets have an m-plane or a-plane orientation.

Claims.P: a III-nitride semiconductor light emitting device formed on a surface of a III-nitride substrate having a semipolar orientation, wherein the III-nitride substrate is cleaved along a direction substantially perpendicular to a nonpolar orientation of the III-nitride substrate to create one or more cleaved facets of the III-nitride substrate.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the III-nitride semiconductor light emitting device is an edge-emitting laser diode.
3. The device of claim 1, wherein the III-nitride substrate is a semipolar III-nitride substrate.
4. The device of claim 3, wherein the semipolar III-nitride substrate is a semipolar bulk gallium nitride substrate.
5. The device of claim 1, wherein the cleaved facets have an m-plane or a-plane orientation.
6. The device of claim 1, wherein the III-nitride substrate is thinned to facilitate cleaving.
7. The device of claim 1, wherein the substrate has a cleavage line along a direction substantially perpendicular to a nonpolar orientation of the substrate for the cleaved facets.
8. A process for fabricating an optoelectronic device, comprising:
forming a III-nitride semiconductor light emitting device on a surface of a III-nitride substrate having a semipolar orientation; and

cleaving the III-nitride substrate along a direction substantially perpendicular to a nonpolar orientation of the III-nitride substrate to create one or more cleaved facets of the III-nitride substrate.
9. The method of claim 8, wherein the III-nitride semiconductor light emitting device is an edge-emitting laser diode.
10. The method of claim 8, wherein the III-nitride substrate is a semipolar III-nitride substrate.
11. The method of claim 10, wherein the semipolar III-nitride substrate is a semipolar bulk gallium nitride substrate.
12. The method of claim 8, wherein the cleaved facets have an m-plane or a-plane orientation.
13. The method of claim 8, further comprising thinning the III-nitride substrate to facilitate cleaving.

14. The method of claim 8, wherein the cleaving step comprises creating a cleavage line along a direction substantially perpendicular to a nonpolar orientation of the substrate, and then applying force along the cleavage line to create the cleaved facets.
